content: The common story that AI coding assistants only make developers faster is an oversimplification; the reality of front-end engineering in the age of AI is more complex.
Front-end engineering, specifically the hand-implementation of pages, is becoming cheap and repeatable work due to AI-driven workflows.
The shift to composability transforms the front-end engineer's role from a 'ticket-taker' to a 'system designer'.
Auditability and row-level security require rethinking for dynamic UIs, especially when AI agents become the primary consumers of tools.
AI-driven workflows can now take Figma designs and directly output complete component trees, reducing the need for manual UI primitive construction.

The future role for front-end engineers will involve designing the primitives, schemas, and contracts that enable entire organizations to ship interfaces effectively without compromising user experience.
Front-end engineers who master composability will gain significant leverage in the evolving landscape.
